description: From de- +â€Ž specificate, with de- acting as an intensifier.

verbs.description: despecificate (third-person singular simple present despecificates, present participle despecificating, simple past and past participle despecificated)

entries.meaning: (rare) To discriminate; to separate according to specific signification or qualities; to specificate; to desynonymize.
examples: Inaptitude and ineptitude have been usefully despecificated, and only the latter now imparts folly.
